bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to L.O. Howard, March 14, 1925

div1.p: Kean encloses a reprint of his review of the Gorgas biography for publication in "Science."

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to L.O. Howard, March 14, 1925
div1.opener:
Reed & Gorgas II
March 14, 1925.
Dr. L. O. Howard,
Chief, Bureau of Entomology,
Agriculture Department,
Washington, D. C.
My dear Dr. Howard:
div1.p:
I was much pleased to get your very nice
letter with reference to my review of the Life of
Gorgas. General Ireland has been likewise much
pleased with it and thinkgs that it is due to the
memory of Reed to have it given a wider circulation
than would be reached by The Military Surgeon. Mr.
Neumann here in the Library has suggested that you
might be able to procure its reprinting in Science
which would be the best vehicle for its reaching
the scientific world. I am encouraged to fall in
with this suggestion on account of the interest
which your friend, Mr. Baker, took in the matter
last spring. I am sending you, therefore, a reprint
of it which you can use in the way suggested above
or in any other way that seems appropriate.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, J. R. KEAN
Colonel, U. S. Army, Retired
Editor. JRK/W
